com.percussion.services.assembly
Interface IPSAssemblyService

All Superinterfaces:
IPSAssembler, IPSCataloger, IPSTemplateService
public interface IPSAssemblyService
extends IPSAssembler, IPSTemplateService, IPSCataloger

The assembler service acts as a toplevel assembler that dispatches to component assemblers on the basis of the passed template, and additionally supplies the methods to manipulate templates and slots. See the super interface descriptions for more details.

Assembling an item may start with the assembly servlet, or a direct call to the assembly service. The service performs the following steps when assembling items:

  • Load the content item
  • Bind initial site and other context variables passed in with the assembly item
  • Bind HTTP params passed in with the assembly items
  • Bind extension functions
  • Evalute the template bindings to create a final set of bound variables
  • Bind extra objects for plugin, e.g. $sys.asm to the assembler facade.
  • Invoke the assembly plugin
  • Construct result object and return

The assembly service does not do these steps for one, specific plug-in. The legacy content assembler is simply handed the same data, without binding or calculating a context

Author:
dougrand

ASSEMBLY_URL

static final String ASSEMBLY_URL
The URL to invoke the assembly service. This is a partial URL from the context down.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

createAssemblyItem

IPSAssemblyItem createAssemblyItem(String path,
                                   long jobid,
                                   int refid,
                                   IPSAssemblyTemplate template,
                                   Map<String,String> variables,
                                   Map<String,String[]> params,
                                   Node optionalNode,
                                   boolean debug)
                                   throws PSAssemblyException
Deprecated. use createAssemblyItem() and call the setters and IPSAssemblyItem.normalize() instead.

Method used to create new assembly items. This method must be used to create items that will work with the assembly system. Note that after the item is created, data has been normalized. The normalization process may cause an exception to be thrown if, for example, essential information is missing.

You do not need to call IPSAssemblyItem.normalize() if you call this factory method.

Parameters:
path - the path of the content item, never null or empty. May have the form "/cid#revision" for items that are not in a folder.
jobid - The job identifier, should not repeat for a long time. This allows the assembly system to cache information for a particular publishing run.
refid - Identifies a particular request in a publishing run, only needs to be unique within a run.
template - The template to render this item with, must not be null
variables - site or other variables that should be made available to the assembler
params - parameters to the assembly process. When invoked from the servlet, all HTTP parameters should be bound here
optionalNode - a node to put in the assembly item, may be null, in which case the assembly service will load the node using the path supplied to this method
debug - if true the item will be assembled in debug mode
Returns:
an item suitable for the call to IPSAssembler.assemble(List)
Throws:
PSAssemblyException - if there is a problem creating the item

createAssemblyItem

IPSAssemblyItem createAssemblyItem()
Create an assembly item to be used with the assembly service. Once this method is called, use the setters on the assembly item to setup information to be used in assembly. Once these are called, you must call the IPSAssemblyItem.normalize() method before assembling the item.

Returns:
an uninitialized assembly item, never null

processServletRequest

IPSAssemblyResult processServletRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                        String template,
                                        String templateid)
                                        throws PSAssemblyException
Process an assembly item using data passed into the assembly servlet. Internally this calls createAssemblyItem(String, long, int, IPSAssemblyTemplate, Map, Map, Node, boolean) after looking up the pieces of the request, and then calls IPSAssembler.assemble(List).

Parameters that may be passed, and the validation rules for them:

sys_path the path to the content item, if this is not null and not empty then it will be used in favor of the contentid, revision and folderid. If this is not present then the other parameters must be present. The revision may be specified by appending #nnn to the path, where nnn is an integer that corresponds to the desired revision.
sys_contentid the content id of the content item, may be omitted if path is specified
sys_revision the revision of the content item, may be omitted if path is specified. If the revision is not specified or is the value -1 then the current revision or edit revision will be used. The edit revision will be used if the logged in user has the item checked out (as determined by HttpServletRequest.getRemoteUser().
sys_folderid the folder id of the folder that contains the content item, may be omitted if the path is specified
sys_filter the name of the item filter to use when evaluating slot content finders. May be omitted if authtype is specified. If specified then authtype is ignored.
sys_authtype the id of the authtype to use when evaluating slot content finders. Must translate to a registered finder or an error will be thrown. May be omitted or empty if filter is specified.
sys_siteid the id of the site to use for finding various pieces of information including site variables, global templates, etc. Not required.
sys_context the context to assemble in. The context controls the expression of links in the assembled output, required.
sys_mode if this value is "AA" then an internal parameter is set to allow field and slot macros to show active assembly decorations.
sys_debug if this value is "true" then the assembler will not call the assembly plugin, but will instead return debugging information in html format.

Parameters:
request - the original servlet request, the parameters are taken from this and passed into the assembler, never null
template - the name of the template to use in assembly. The template provides various pieces of input data, including what assembly plugin to run and any textual input it requires. May be null or empty if templateid is specified.
templateid - the numeric id of the template to use, may be null or empty if template is specified.
Returns:
the result of the assembly, never null
Throws:
PSAssemblyException

loadFinder

IPSSlotContentFinder loadFinder(String finder)
                                throws PSAssemblyException
Load the named finder via the extensions manager.

Parameters:
finder - the finder to load, never null or empty, corresponds to the name that the finder was registered with the extensions manager.
Returns:
a finder instance, never null
Throws:
PSAssemblyException - if there is a problem loading the finder

getLandingPageLink

String getLandingPageLink(IPSAssemblyItem parentItem,
                          Node landingPage,
                          IPSGuid templateId)
                          throws PSAssemblyException
Calculate a landing page url for the given landing page node. The node was previously loaded using the content manager. This is generally called by the managed nav implementation internally.

If the template being referenced is a legacy template then the item is assembled and parsed to find the first anchor tag, and the href attribute is extracted and returned.

For new templates, the requirement is that the bindings include a binding for the variable $pagelink. The template is partially assembled, and the value of $pagelink is returned.

Parameters:
parentItem - the parent assembly item, never null. The parent item is cloned for the assembly
landingPage - the landing page node being referenced, never null
templateId - the template id of the landing page snippet, never null
Returns:
the url for the landing page, never null or empty
Throws:
PSAssemblyException - if there is a problem

setCurrentAssemblyItem

void setCurrentAssemblyItem(IPSAssemblyItem item)
The assembly engine calls this from assemblers and inside the service to set the current assembly item being addressed. This value is stored in thread local storage, and is safe to use within the thread.

Assembly plugin implementations that do not use the base assembler implementation should call this method.

Parameters:
item - an assembly item to store, may be null to reset the value

getCurrentAssemblyItem

IPSAssemblyItem getCurrentAssemblyItem()
This method allows a caller to discover the current item being assembled. There may be no current item at times, e.g. some code is called outside of the assembly service but may wish to use this call to obtain the current item when available.

Returns:
the current item or null if undefined.

handleItemTemplates

void handleItemTemplates(List<IPSAssemblyItem> items)
                         throws PSAssemblyException
Lookup the template for one or more assembly items. The method first creates a map of the content types of the items. Then it runs through the items. The map could be optimized out for cases where only the ids are passed in, but moving toward names this may prove to be the common case.

This method is used internally in assembly, and also externally by the publishing engine when processing work items for unpublishing.

Parameters:
items - the items to look up the templates for, assumed not null
Throws:
PSAssemblyException
